title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.10 Part 5 | 19-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Mirandasya Gyananjani Shalakaya Chakshur Unmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namah
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Krishna attracts everyone because he has got unlimited transcendental qualities.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the Atmarama verse and discusses how Krishna's transcendental qualities attract even liberated souls, purifying and enlightening those who engage in devotional service.

segments.key_quote: But through devotional service one realizes Krishna, the personality of Godhead Bhagavan.
segments.summary: The lecture explains the three processes of realizing the Absolute Truth: philosophical speculation (Brahman), mystic yoga (Paramatma), and devotional service (Bhagavan), emphasizing that devotional service leads to the highest realization.

segments.key_quote: By spontaneous devotional service one attains the original personality of Godhead Krishna and by the Regulative process one attains the expansion of the Supreme personality of Godhead.
segments.summary: The speaker differentiates between spontaneous and regulative devotional service, highlighting that spontaneous devotion in Vrindavan leads to Krishna, while regulative practice leads to expansions of the Supreme Lord.

segments.key_quote: The Supreme personality of Godhead Krishna the son of Mother Yashoda is accessible to those devotees engaged in spontaneous loving service.
segments.summary: The lecture quotes Shukadeva Goswami, emphasizing that Krishna is most accessible through spontaneous loving service, not through mental speculation or austerities.

segments.key_quote: By executing regulative devotional service one becomes an associate of Narayana and attains the Vaikunthalokas, the spiritual planets and the spiritual sky.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that regulative devotional service leads to association with Narayana and attainment of the Vaikuntha planets, while spontaneous devotion is characterized by tears, jubilation, and inherent spiritual qualities.

segments.key_quote: Devotional service, however, is so strong and independent that it can give one all the desired results.
segments.summary: The lecture categorizes devotees based on their desires (desireless, liberation-seeking, materially desiring) and emphasizes that even with ulterior motives, devotional service is powerful enough to grant all desired results.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is so kind that when a devotee foolishly desires some material gain, Krishna gives himself to the devotee and he attracts the devotee so very much.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the story of Dhruva Maharaj to illustrate how Krishna, out of kindness, attracts devotees even when they initially desire material gains, ultimately leading them to detachment and pure devotion.
